Hardware Environment:

Software Environment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux AS release 3 (Taroon Update 5

Build: AC-4.2.0-200606050621


Steps to Reproduce:
1. Import WAS activity text log (attached)
2. Search for msg = "*Failed to start MDB PSSampleMDB*"
3. Open properties view on this record
4. Click on Extended Data Elements tab in properties view

Actual Results:
Error dialog is displayed.  The following exception is in the error log.

Expected Results:

Created an attachment (id=60103)
Proposed patch for NPE

I have a attached a patch for this annoying bug.

Apparently, in the GTK implementation of the SWT toolkit, it's possible for Scrollable.getHorizontalBar() to return null. (I assume this is not the case in Windows.) The ExtendedDataElementsSection has an anonymous ControlListener on the "Values" columm that tries to setMaximum() on the ScrollBar of the TreeViewer's container. Obviously, if the ScrollBar is null, this will throw an NPE and the section will not be drawn.

Without understanding why it's necessary to adjust the ScrollBar in this fashion, the safest fix was to wrap the ScrollBar.setMaximum() call with a null check. The patch also fixes a similar bug in GenericTreeSection which affects the Correlation Data Attributes and Situation tabs.

Thanks for investigating and providing a fix Mark. After validating your fix I concluded that actually setting the max scroll bar value doesn't make sense to me so I removed the calls from the two classes.
